abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental assessment comprises
            two volumes, the environmental action plan, which lays the
            foundation to proactively improve the environment, and, the
            environmental management plan, which stipulates the
            mitigation measures that will ensure adequate environmental
            protection. The design phase shall consider project selected
            roads for routine maintenance works, limited to the existing
            right-of-way, and, include waste collection in accordance to
            current regulations. In case of archaeological finds, the
            related archaeological authorities shall be informed, who
            should proceed to its preservation. Procurement documents
            will include provisions to ensure embankment stabilization,
            particularly around bridges, and culverts, through
            re-vegetation practices, and technologies to contain
            unstable slope terrains; while drainage discharges will be
            monitored to reduce erosion. During construction,
            contracting precautionary clauses shall specify the required
            materials - from asphalt plants, stone quarries, and borrow
            pits - to be environmentally valid, and licensed for use.
            Transport, and operating equipment will be required to use
            covers, or spray truck loads, which should be transported at
            off peak hours to minimize traffic congestion. Construction
            activities will be limited to daylight working schedules, to
            reduce noise, and dust pollution. Construction debris will
            be disposed of in accordance to local environmental
            regulations, and at selected sites, while sediments, and
            solid wastes will undergo toxicity testing prior to
            appropriate disposal. During the operation phase, periodic
            maintenance will be subjected to a Safety Audit, and a
            review process by the consultant road safety specialist, in
            line with a road workers protection policy to be adopted.
